text: Leonardo Bondumier (1605–1668) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Archbishop of Split (1641–1668). ==Biography== Leonardo Bondumier was born in Venice, Italy in 1605. On 15 April 1641, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Urban VIII as Archbishop of Split. On 21 April 1641, he was consecrated bishop by Alessandro Cesarini (iuniore), Cardinal-Deacon of Sant'Eustachio. He served as Archbishop of Split until his death in 1668. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Urban VIII Category:1605 births Category:1668 deaths
title: Leonard Bondumier
